SENT.plain: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia (CDH) is often associated with major anomalies and chromosomal abnormalities

Chromosomal abnormalities are usually detected in 9.5% to 34% of fetuses with CDH prenatally diagnosed and the defect has also been reported in association with multiple syndromes such as Pallister-Killian syndrome, Fryns syndrome, Di George syndrome and Apert syndrome
Among the chromosomal abnormalities associated with CDH, trisomy 21, 18, and 13 are most common
Association with complex chromosomal aberrations such as mosaicism has also been reported
However, CDH presented in a fetus with Y-autosome translocation is extremely rare
Herein, we reported a case of fetus with 46,XY/46,X,-Y, +der(Y)t(Y;1)(q12;q12) mosaicism who presented with CDH diagnosed by ultrasonography at 19 weeks' gestation
